hi everyone! I am currently using my self-defined method to create block-diagonal matrices on the fly:
```blkdiagm(A::Matrix, B::Matrix) = [A zeros(size(A,1), size(B,2)); zeros(size(B,1), size(A,2)) B]
blkdiagm(A::Matrix... ) = blkdiagm(A[1], blkdiagm(A[2:end]...))```
the issue, is that this definition seems to become a bottleneck with larger problems and I am not quite sure - it seems to be the concatanation. (In most cases I only use the 2-argument one).

So I guess the best option is to instead do
```C = zeros(m1+m2, n1+n2)
C[1:m1,1:n1] .= A
C[m1+1:end,n1+1:end] .= B```
is there a better way? any suggestions?
